thread.title: Man arrested on gun and weapon charges after scooter case
thread.title_full: Man arrested on gun and weapon charges after scooter case - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: FOX8Live.com Staff
title: Man arrested on gun and weapon charges after scooter case
text:
NEW ORLEANS (WVUE) - Louisiana State Police arrested a New Orleans man on weapon and drug charges after he led them on a chase, riding a scooter through the St. Claude area.
Troopers were patrolling the area when they saw a 2014 Victory Ness Scooter with no license plate. They said the rider was not wearing a helmet.
When troopers tried to stop the scooter, the driver drove away. He made it several blocks before abandoning the scooter at the intersection of North Robertson Street and Gallier Street.
Officers arrested Wayne Jones, 22, and allegedly found him with a .40 caliber semi-automatic pistol and over 20 grams of marijuana packaged for sale.
The scooter was reported stolen from the New Orleans. Jones had two active warrants for probation violations. When he was taken to the hospital for a medical screening, police say they found a bottle of prescription pain medication Jones was hiding.
Officers booked Jones into the Orleans Parish Prison on charges of possession with intent to distribute a controlled dangerous substance, possession of marijuana, possession of stolen property, possession of a firearm by a convicted felon, Illegal carrying of a weapon with a controlled dangerous substance, operating a vehicle without a license or proper endorsement, operating a vehicle without proper registration and proof of liability insurance, no safety helmet, resisting an officer, aggravated flight from an officer, and the two active warrants.
His bond is set at $40,000. He remains in jail.
